entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels and Ice Jam Potential on Interior Rivers... Spring breakup is picking up speed in the Middle Tanana Valley and across the Interior with the warm temperatures this past week and over the weekend. Significant melting of the snowpack was observed in the Fairbanks area and now that water is rapidly making its way into the waterways. Rivers and stream around Fairbanks continue
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued May 01 at 9:15PM AST until May 03 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves between of 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Northwest to eastern beaches of Puerto Rico, including Culebra and across all the U.S. Virgin Islands.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 2:02PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow Tonight and Monday Morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow. Accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts around 10 inches above 9000 feet. Snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches around South Pass.
